meanings.sent1: After his demobbed, he started a new chapter in his life.
meanings.sent2: The demobbed of the soldiers was a cause for celebration.
meanings.sent3: The demobbed of the troops meant they could finally go home to their families.
meanings.sent4: The demobbed of the sailor was like setting a bird free from its cage.
meanings.sent5: The demobbed of the veteran was a long-awaited moment of freedom.

meanings.definition: To discharge from the armed forces.
meanings.sent1: The commander demobbed the soldiers after their tour of duty.
meanings.sent2: She demobbed the recruits with a sense of pride in their service.
meanings.sent3: The general demobbed the troops with a salute and a farewell speech.
meanings.sent4: The army demobbed the unit, allowing them to return to civilian life.
meanings.sent5: He demobbed the veteran with gratitude for their service to the country.

meanings.definition: To return to civilian life after military service.
meanings.sent1: After being demobbed, he found a job in the city.
meanings.sent2: She demobbed from the army and started a new career.
meanings.sent3: The demobbed soldier had to adjust to life outside the barracks.
meanings.sent4: The demobbed marine missed the camaraderie of the military.
meanings.sent5: He demobbed smoothly and integrated back into civilian society.
